column4: Why can't I use "Make usb start up disk" with other .iso files, like other distros?
make the volume autofs is fine
add a line just like this: /dev/cdrom    /media/CDROM  autofs   default   0 0
actually I'm using an  .iso file, not a cd
or you just add a startup script : sudo mount   ****/*.iso    /media/CDROM   -oloop
after adding the line, I still can't use the utilityit says "This is not a desktop install CD and thus cannot be used by this application."
It looks like this " /media/Daniel's Stuff_/OS ISOs    /media/CDROM   loop==>autofs default  0 0
...no I mean change the loop to auto
the latest solution is /home/car/r/II.iso /home/car/r/II udf,iso9660 user,loop 0 0
